message.content:
1. Strategic planning: This type of planning involves developing a strategy for the organization to achieve its long-term goals and objectives. It includes analyzing internal and external factors, determining the mission and vision, setting strategic goals, devising action plans to achieve those goals, allocating resources, and monitoring progress.

2. Operational planning: This is the process of creating short-term plans that are aligned with the overall strategic plan of an organization. It focuses on day-to-day activities that keep the operations running smoothly while working towards achieving performance targets.

3. Financial planning: Financial planning aims at ensuring sufficient funds are available for an organization to meet its operational needs and pursue growth opportunities. This type of planning involves budgeting, expense tracking, forecasting revenue streams, managing cash flow efficiently and monitoring financial performance.

4. Sales/marketing/business development: Sales or marketing strategies involve identifying target markets/customers/partners/clients;7 deciding most effective channels/promotional mix tactics/viral campaigns/growth hacks etc., basically offering irresistible deals consumers can’t refuse/actions required convincing prospects’ accept lucrative offers!

5.Contingency/emergency/risk management/customer business continuity profile Preparing possible future scenarios taking proactively risk mitigation.
Emergency…prevent disaster happen crippling company affairs (think cyber attack/fire/flooding!)

6.Resource allocation/distribution
Deciding best location store cash/belongings…avoid burglary!
Similarly organizations need judiciously valuable scarce employees’ time/equipment/money key Ensure skills/necessary equipment/intellectual property rights distributed equitably MAXIMUM efficiency productivity effectiveness!!!

7.Project mgt Specific activities scheduling defining budgets…the whole ‘kaboodle.’

8.Production operations Applies businesses manufacture products

Planning production lines/staffs levels/supply chain dynamics…

9.Talent/times
